law.catch_line: A certification by a local official to the Comptroller shall include:...

text.section:
A certification by a local official to the Comptroller shall include:
the full name and address of the person and any other names known to be used by the person;
the Social Security number or federal tax identification number, if known;
the amount of the tax or other liability including:
a statement indicating the nature of the liability; and
in the case of a liability for taxes, a detailed statement for each taxable year showing tax, interest, and penalty; and
a statement that all administrative remedies and appeals have been exhausted and that the tax or other liability has become final.
The Comptroller shall determine if a person for whom a certification is received is due a refund of Maryland tax or a vendor payment.

If an individual filed a joint income tax return, the Comptroller may not withhold or pay to a political subdivision the individual's income tax refund unless the certification includes both names of the individuals filing the joint income tax return.
